reviewText:
The download was like... 170MB? I bet your average porn video would take longer to download... and would be way more exciting.

Anyways, I wasn't a fan of this game. Here's why:

When you launch the game, the settings screen appears, giving you options for the game. It's basic graphic stuff and keybindings, nothing special. The graphic settings range (and I'm not making this up) from Good, to Beautiful, all the way to Fantastic! And, of course, you can change the resolution too and which display you want the game on as well as if you want the game to be windowed or not.

At the start of this game (if you can even call it that... probably finished it in less than 15 minutes) you are greeted by a somewhat nice looking starting screen. You'll probably be thinking Golly! The other reviews might just be wrong! Looks like a thrilling indie game ahead!" If this is what you think
date: then you might as well not play and save whatever is left of your hopes and dreams.\n\nHowever
recommended: if you do decide to continue

reviewText:
I'd like to warn that there are some pretty graphic and disturbing imagery in this game, some of it live footage. I did not appreciate being shown this without being warned of it before purchasing and playing this game, and I would strongly urge the developer to put a warning label visibly in the description.

I was hoping for something along the lines of The Stanley Parable, which I'm sure was a big inspiration for this game. What I actually got was a pretty badly designed game with extremely awkward controls (the crosshair/dot is not static in the middle and moves to the edge of the screen, which makes it near impossible to select and click on things), a computer voiced narrator, and a story pretending to be clever like Stanley, but missing the mark entirely.

Would not recommend, even if it was free.

reviewText: Well, for one thing the controls are just awkward. I had to double click everything with a little black pointer, but I had to use the mouse to look around. So I'd end up looking at a wall while trying to click one of the objects.\nAnd the ending is just bad. Very bad. Any semblance of subtlety the game had going for it (not a lot) was ruined in the last minute of the game. It just spells out everything with some white text on a blank background.\nSave your two dollars for taco bell or something.

reviewText:
Alright, pick your poison on this one:

- Contains graphic, live action video footage of people being killed and injured, surgery, animals being butchered, and god knows what else. There's no warning it's coming.

- None of your choices effect anything in the game. There is a single part where you can get a different verbal response, but every scene plays out the same way.

- Any subtlety they were going for in the story gets weaker and weaker up until the very end, where it gets spelled out for you in no uncertain terms in white text over a black background.

- It's 10 minutes long. Don't get me wrong, I like some games that can take very little time to beat"
date: but you get everything your first time through with no reason to go back.\n\n- Can be summed up with "The Stanley Parable

reviewText: An absolute abomination of a game that relies on a rather gimmic-y plot twist if you can even call it that. Lets just say the longest portion of the game is a shock film that's supposed to make you feel a certain level of digust or displeasure but really is poorly laid out and in like 120p. The game itself well the 10-20 minutes of it are focused around you being interviewed by Microsoft Sam's Ghost. You answer simple questions with 1 of the 2 answers they give you inivitably leading to an end which will absolutely leave you feeling hollow inside as it provides you with noting more than a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ plot twist delivered with whatever ♥♥♥♥♥ assets the dev could snatch up for free. The game in and of itself had a semi decent concept yet managed to absolutely booger it up with the way the game plays. So the last thing I want to say is to keep your 2 bucks and spend it elsewhere and if you can still go get a refund I suggest doing so this game is dreadfully boring and certainly not worth your hard earned pocket change. 3/10 Ya ♥♥♥♥ed up interview. If you would like to see gameplay here is a link.\nhttps://youtu.be/jmVzImWpgT0

reviewText:
There's nothing wrong with experimental games like 'The Interview' as long as it does something..... well... experimental, I guess.

The Interview tries to shock although it did not really work for me personally but the intention was there, can't explain much about it since you would be explaining the whole 'game'.

There are game breaking bugs (getting stuck somewhere). Also you have to use your mouse + another black cursor (sometimes hard to see) which feels pretty weird.

Overall I wouldn't recommend this one.

reviewText:
A manic depressive version of Stanley Parable with a similar 'there is something nasty in the box' ending as the movie 'Se7en'. Game was created by Anothink who created other similar pieces of gaming art excrement which can be found here... http://www.moddb.com/members/anothink/games . This is a poor man's rendition of sending out a meaningless art message in the hope that they drum up a fan base from those who contemplate life after sniffing a empty gasoline can.

The game starts off with the false premise that you (character named Adam) are in some sort of Job interview. Your presented with various questions which you must answer by simply clicking yes or no, or 1 and 2 on the number pad. Eventually as your presented with ground churning background animation of moving corridors and knives coming through the walls and some snuff video, you will either do 1 of two things. 1) Throw up and look through your barf to try and find $1.99 worth of entertainment or 2) Go outside and listen to the birds singing to try and feel good about breathing again.

This is 10 minute maximum piece of trash is definitely no David Fincher masterpiece its only redeeming feature is that I can use it to see if Steams new delete this game forever from my library actually works. If not i'll be downloading it onto a disc and have it ready waiting outside on the curb for bin day.

The game ends with a picture of a blue box. What's inside the Blue Box? Hopefully the head of Anothink and their developing career. Feel free to collect the blue box and take that out for bin day too.

This game is absolute garbage and i can't suggest anyone to waste your money on this ♥♥♥♥. Theres not much to say about this piece of ♥♥♥♥ of a game. All you do is walk around and press on stuff and thats it. Nothing ever changes. The VO is ♥♥♥♥ing awfull as its just a generic google speak system that voices the game. The game looks awfull and zero effort was put into this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game. The game is also short as hell it only took me 10 minutes to finish the whole ♥♥♥♥ing thing. I feel like a ♥♥♥♥♥ for spending money on this garbage and don't make the same mistake i did. Overall theres nothing good about The Interview it is one of the worst games i have ever played and without a doubt skip this one and don't even look back. I give The Interview a 1/10

reviewText:
Lets start off with how long it is shall we?  Its short, like I can beat the game in 5 minutes no problem, just make the choice, move through and struggle to click the next thing.

Next lets talk about what I mean by struggle to click, well you see the thing you use to make the selections (choices) and click on the two objects there are in this game... is freaking hard, because as you move the camera, the little tiny pointer moves too, so either you can't very well see what your clicking (which spoiler: it doesn't matter what you choose), or your becoming frustrated at this little pointer to move in sync with your camera.

Now lets go into the level design, BAD, like there was a part where you cross the planks of wood to get to the box, and if you fall, you have to exit the game and start again, then there was the long grid like walk-way thing that was so long it made me, put my hand to my head as I walked through it because I was so bored...  even the interview room isn't that nice, to be fully out with it, it is just blocky, with little work done to any of this game.

Did I mention it only took me 5 minutes to beat this game, well I'm saying it again, this is my fastest time I beat it, for I wanted to try every choice, knowing it would lead me down the same path...  but really as you can all tell this isn't a normal interview right?  Well I'm not going to spoil it for you, but if you want to know, look it up online instead of buying this game, it will be more worth it in the end.

I give this game a 1/10 <-it deserves less, but I never go 0; and do not recommend this game to anyone... like at all...  I hope this game burns, I don't want to fell like Adam felt... I didn't do what he did, and I really don't care, and even if this was the intent, make more Story telling, this is just plain boring and stupid.  I hear it now, No your a towel!""

reviewText: Well, it has its ups and downs. Like, a lot of downs. The controls are the worst I've seen in any game ever. You know how the cursor is usually pinned to the middle of the screen in first person games? Yeah, in this one, it moves across the screen with really low sensitivity as you move the camera around. Fortunately, the things you have to click on are very close together, so you don't have to struggle through too much of this. The game has the kind of graphics you'd expect from Unity. Which is to say, my eyes hurt. Despite all of these, the twist ending really did get me. But that stupid credits music... ugh. Ruined the dark, serious mood of the whole game. In fact, it really feels sick and disrespectful to use that kind of music. The other reviews have warnings about this, and I feel I should include one too; This game does have real, actual footage of people dying. Not actors, not a game character, not a 3d model of a person. Real people dying. Anyway, after playing through it once, I was disappointed to find that you get the same results regardless of what choices you make in the game. So, overall, good story, dreadful execution. It frankly would have been better published as a short story or film. If you do buy it, get it on sale. If I had the choice, I wouldn't swing either way on recommended/not recommended.

I love weird games but this was over the limt. The game is full on trippy and it bothered me to a full degree. It was full on disturbing and I feel it had a ton of stupid questions.

It was a mind♥♥♥♥, making you think vise versa and etc. I understand what they tried to do but all the same it was so-so.

I have played better and this one made little sense if any.

Either way here is my let's play for it. Hope it helps you folks out!

reviewText: I got this in a LazyGuys bundle. I would guess that I paid about 25 cents for it. date: and I learned something new... true
recommended: it's a fact of questionable worth
hoursPlayed: but still. So all in all

helpfulPercent: hydrating and informative.\n\nI'm sad to say that my trip to the kitchen was in every way a more enjoyable

reviewText:
I would pass this despite the short length and price, if not for one thing. At the very end, the game spells out the entire plot. That's treating the player like an idiot. I'd already picked up on it and I liked that there was still some air of mystery to it.

But then nope, gotta destroy that real quick.

Sigh. It's a neat little experimental game otherwise but there's literally no replay value. I got this in a bundle though so who am I to complain.

But I'm not an idiot, devs, and you don't need to treat me like one.

reviewText:
I have some complaints about it, mainly presentation wise. The text to voice software didn't do the game any favors, I seriously would've looked for some real voice talent for this. My mouse kept getting off center and it got to be annoying at times.

The atmosphere was really good and I didn't see the twist coming until near the end. One thing that might've made it a bit better is if the choices had a bit more of an impact on the story, say Adam coming to terms with what he'd done or going even deeper into denial.

It was short but it did what it needed to.

reviewText:
The only flaws I had an issue with is the length of this game and the fact that you charge money. Honestly though, for 2$, the experience I went through during my 10 minuites playing this game was well worth it. There was so much potential with this to have more endings than just the same one as well, due to all the different choice options. I hope you make another and longer game sometime.

I really enjoyed it, the atmosphere, colors, graphics, and audio were awesome. Will play again, and will definitely be having my friends play it when they are over to get spooked.

7/10, nice little psych horror experience.

reviewText:
Summary:

Pros

- Surreal horror experience
- Dark humor
- References to horror movies
- Funny computer voice
- very good ending sequence

Cons

- Extremely Short
- Minimal gameplay (Make choices, walk to a goal)
- Mouse control and cursor not optimized
- Disturbing live footage (you can make your character look elsewhere, if you want)

I got this game in a bundle and, before playing this game, I played Insert Title Here" and "An Apparently Normal Room"
date: both games from the same developer (http://www.desura.com/members/anothink/development to check these titles). These are all very short games
recommended: and can be considered as low-budget walking simulators
hoursPlayed: with The Stanley Parable as a source of inspiration. These two games are free on Desura
voteText: so you can play them to have an idea what The Interview is like.\n\nThe Interview looks a lot like those two games
helpfulPercent: but there are two main differences:\n\n1) It offers fake choices that are intended to make the player actually think what he would do in real life
votesHelpful: but they offer no changes in the game.\n\n2)  It contains live footage where you can watch murder scenes
votesTotal: war scenes and other horrible things
votesFunny: so this game is obviously not recommended to kids or sensitive people (the other games have horror elements as well
commentsCount: but no live footage of violence)\n\nSo
column16: should you get it? If you are looking for a short (I took 12 minutes to finish it)
column19: even if it has some gameplay faults (clicking is a bit unresponsive and the mouse cursor is not on the center of the screen)
column21: and the ending is really nice. Unlike some people might think
column22: just watching this on Youtube would not be the same thing
column23: and I also recommend using earphones to really enjoy this game.\n\nAbout the price? Well
column25: but it certainly will not take long for this game to be on a sale
column26: so get it once the price is good enough for you
column27: considering it will be a very short but interesting ride."

reviewerDisplayName: ALT+F4 to see my real name
reviewText:
Interesting experiment, but it feels like it needs a little more polish overall. The concept is really interesting, leaving you with many questions; but at times I feel like it bombards you with too many questions, assailing you with dozens of overlapping themes. Maybe if it were longer, 30 minutes at least, The Interview would succeed more at what it is trying to accomplish. There is potential here but definitely a lot of unused potential. I am looking forward to what this developer puts out next.

5.5/10 - Average/Good

Despite the rating, if you are interested in these really vague, experimental games, I definitely recommend giving this a shot.

reviewText:
At first I made a pretty angry review on the game, but it's not THAT ♥♥♥♥♥♥ actually.

The concept is simple: you're in a job interview but progressively things get more and more ♥♥♥♥ed up until a final plot twist is reacher.

Gameplay consists of walking and making choices (if I remember correctly, always based on 2 options)

It's obvious psychological horror, no monster to hide from, no real shower of gore, but a disturbing unsettling ambience.

But I don't recommend it because it's horribly short, for that length it's not worth the price. (10 minutes playthrough if you're the observative/slow kind of player) and no replay value. at all.

At that price I'd have no shame going to youtube watch a full playthrough and just see what's in it.

Sad though, I think there was a good potential here.
